entry.title: ðŸ”­ Mastering Observability: Deploying the OpenTelemetry Demo on Kubernetes
entry.summary: If you're working with OpenTelemetry (OTel) and Kubernetes, or looking to get started, having a practical environment to experiment in is invaluable. Setting up observability from scratch can be complex, so leveraging a ready-made, realistic example can significantly speed up the learning process. The official OpenTelemetry "Astronomy Shop" demo is designed precisely for this â€“ it's much more than just a sample application. Think of it as a pre-instrumented, multi-service online store built specifically to help us explore how distributed systems tick (and sometimes break!). It lets you see firsthand how tools like OpenTelemetry can help track down performance bottlenecks or tricky errors in a microservices setup. In this post, I'll walk you through setting up this fantastic demo environmenâ€¦

entry.title: Singleton vs. Monostate in C#: Understand the Difference with a Real-World Story and Code Examples
entry.summary: Learn the difference between Singleton and Monostate design patterns in C# through a simple real-world story. Discover when to use each, how they work, and see full code examples to help you write cleaner, more maintainable code. When designing applications in C#, we sometimes need to ensure that a class behaves in a global or shared way â€” whether that means only one instance exists, or that all instances share the same state. Two popular design patterns for this are the Singleton and the Monostate. They might seem similar at first, but theyâ€™re actually quite different under the hood. Letâ€™s explore both using a story youâ€™ll never forget. Imagine you work in a big company. Thereâ€™s only one office manager, and her name is Sarah. Everyone in the company talks to Sarah when they need: Time offâ€¦

entry.title: I Built an AI-Powered Art Digest That Writes and Illustrates Itself
entry.summary:
I Built an AI-Powered Art Digest That Writes and Illustrates Itself
What happens when you combine real-time news, generative AI, and modern art? You get Unjica â€” a living, breathing editorial that curates and reimagines contemporary art stories using OpenAI and custom code. As a developer and art enthusiast, I wanted to create something that: Keeps up with the fast-moving world of art and exhibitions, Feels editorial (not robotic), Looks beautiful, like a curated magazine, And updates itself â€” daily. Next.js + App Router: for structure and speed
Prisma + PostgreSQL: to store and filter news
OpenAI (GPT-4o & DALLÂ·E 3): to generate articles and header images
R2 Storage: to persist DALLÂ·E outputs
Scheduled CRON jobs on Vercel: for daily automation
Markdown content: clean, simple, structured
âœ¨ What Makes It Interesting
Articles sound like real human writers â€” critical, witty, even poetic.
Visuals are generated with painterly prompts (no generic AI mush).
It's self-sustaining â€” I just keep refining it. Here's a recent post to give you a taste. Tuning prompts to avoid generic AI tone
Balancing automation with taste
Making SEO work with dynamic Open Graph images
ðŸš€ Whatâ€™s Next?
Integrating artist interviews
Letting users vote on which stories should be featured
Adding human + AI collaboration tools
Would love your thoughts â€” or any feedback on how to make it more useful for creators or art lovers. Thanks for reading ðŸ™

entry.title: Research DAO claims paralyzed rats recover after spinal cord fix
entry.summary: Decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) HydraDAO claims that its researchers were able to use a novel technique to repair severed spines in rats. In a May 5 X post, decentralized science (DeSci) project HydraDAO said that one of its research projects resulted in â€œrats who had their spines fully transectedâ€ being able to walk again. More notably, recovery from surgery reportedly only took five days. Source: HydraDAO The post featured a video of partially shaved (presumably due to surgery) rats walking in what appeared to be a laboratory setting. The effort in question is the Dowell spinal fusogens project led by Michael Lebenstein-Gumovski, which raised 380,700 USDC (USDC) from donors. The dedicated HydraDAO page reads: â€œThe Dowell team submitted a project proposal to HydraDAO. After caâ€¦

entry.title: How much Bitcoin can Berkshire Hathaway buy?
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Berkshire holds $347B in cash, enough to buy ~18% of Bitcoinâ€™s supply.
Greg Abel has not signaled a shift from Warren Buffettâ€™s anti-Bitcoin stance.
Berkshire already has indirect crypto exposure via Nu Holdings, Jefferies.
Warren Buffett announced at Berkshire Hathaway's annual shareholder meeting on May 3 that he will step down as CEO by the end of 2025, with Greg Abel taking over. This transition raises speculation about Berkshireâ€™s financial capacity to purchase Bitcoin (BTC) under the new leadership. Source: Discover Crypto Berkshire can easily surpass Strategyâ€™s BTC stash Berkshire ended Q4 2024 with a record $347 billion in cash and US Treasury bills, representing about 32% of its $1.1 trillion market capitalization. The company could acquire approximately 3.52 â€¦

entry.title: How to Properly Use sem_wait and sem_post in C Code?
Why is a project charter essential in project planning?
entry.summary: A project charter is a critical document in project management that lays the foundation for a successful project. It provides direction, clarity, and alignment among all stakeholders. Below is a detailed explanation of why a project charter is essential and how it contributes to project success. **Provides a Clear Project Framework **Defines Roles and Responsibilities Aligns Goals and Success Criteria **Prevents Scope Creep **Reduces Miscommunication **Conclusion: The Importance of a Project Charter **In conclusion, a project charter is an essential tool for ensuring project success. It defines the projectâ€™s purpose, scope, stakeholders, and success criteria. It also helps manage expectations, prevent scope creep, and reduce communication gaps. By starting with a strong project charter, teams can work more efficiently, make better decisions, and achieve their project goals on time and within budget.

What qualities do you think make a great software developer?

entry.title: ðŸ›¡ï¸How I Self-Hosted Signal Private Messenger Server
entry.summary:
In an era where digital privacy is under constant threat, relying solely on third-party infrastructure â€” even from trusted providers â€” isnâ€™t always enough. Thatâ€™s why I decided to self-host the Signal messaging service, giving me complete control over my communication environment and infrastructure. Signal is widely known for its end-to-end encrypted messaging. But hosting your own Signal server takes privacy even further: ðŸš« No third-party data exposure
ðŸ‘ï¸â€ðŸ—¨ï¸ Full transparency of the system ðŸ¢ Private internal messaging for teams or organizations ðŸ” Complete control over infrastructure and data Whether you're a developer, privacy advocate, or a business, self-hosting Signal empowers you with full ownership of your messaging environment. Hereâ€™s a quick look at the tech stack I used: ðŸ³ Docker & Docker Compose
ðŸ’» Ubuntu VPS
ðŸŒ NGINX + Letâ€™s Encrypt
ðŸ” Custom Domain + DNS Configuration
â˜ï¸ Cloud Providers AWS, GCP, Azure, and Cloudflare for advanced DNS, firewall, or load balancing.
ðŸ§ Final Thoughts
Self-hosting Signal isnâ€™t just a tech experiment â€” itâ€™s a strategic move toward digital independence. With todayâ€™s DevOps tooling and open-source software, deploying your own private Signal server is more feasible than ever. ðŸ’¬ If youâ€™re thinking about building your own secure messaging setup or need help with a Signal deployment, feel free to reach out!

entry.title: Is the Paws Telegram mini app legit? What you need to know
entry.summary:
What is the Paws Telegram Mini App?
Paws is a Telegram-based Mini App created by the same team behind other projects, such as Notcoin and Dogs.Â If youâ€™ve been cruising around Telegram lately, chances are youâ€™ve stumbled upon Paws, the viral crypto Mini App thatâ€™s got everyone tapping, clicking and inviting their friends like itâ€™s 2010 FarmVille all over again.Â Originally launched in October 2024 on The Open Network (TON) blockchain, Paws exploded in popularity with its ultra-simple tap-to-earn concept. Think of it as a gamified rewards engine embedded directly in Telegram, where users rack up points by completing tasks, referring others and interacting with mini-game elements.Â Within just eight days of going live, Paws pulled in over 20 million â€¦

entry.title: Crypto spending will grow, but fiat isnâ€™t going anywhere: Mercuryo CEO
entry.summary: Petr Kozyakov, CEO of crypto payments platform Mercuryo, told Cointelegraph that the future of finance may not be a winner-takes-all scenario but a blend of digital assets and fiat, each used where it makes the most sense.Â In a Cointelegraph interview, Kozyakov said that while crypto payments are seeing an increase in adoption and demand, the asset class wonâ€™t be fully replacing fiat money anytime soon. He said the two asset classes will coexist, with people choosing the more convenient payment option in different situations.Â â€œWe donâ€™t think crypto will replace fiat,â€ Kozyakov told Cointelegraph. â€œThey will coexist, and people will turn to crypto when itâ€™s the easier, more practical option, whether thatâ€™s for payroll, yield or money transfers.â€ Mercuryo Petr Kozyakov at the Token2049 eveâ€¦

entry.title: IRS appoints Trish Turner to head crypto division amid resignations
entry.summary: Veteran US Internal Revenue Service (IRS) official Trish Turner was appointed to lead the agencyâ€™s digital assets division following the departure of two key crypto-focused executives. Turner, who has spent over 20 years at the IRS and most recently served as a senior adviser within the Digital Assets Office, will now head the unit, according to a report from Bloomberg Tax citing a person familiar with the situation. Her promotion marks a significant leadership transition at a time when US crypto tax enforcement is facing both internal and external pressures. On May 5, Sulolit â€œRajâ€ Mukherjee and Seth Wilks, two private-sector experts brought in to lead the IRSâ€™s crypto unit, exited after roughly a year in their roles. Mukherjee served as compliance and implementation executive director, wâ€¦

entry.title: OKX exec warns against hype amid real-world asset tokenization boom
entry.summary: The CEO of crypto exchange OKXâ€™s Middle East and North Africa (MENA) division has called on the industry to prioritize real-world utility as interest in tokenizing real-world assets (RWAs) continues to grow. In a Cointelegraph interview at the Token20249 event in Dubai, OKX MENA CEO Rifad Mahasneh warned that while tokenization is promising, projects must â€œclearly demonstrateâ€ the benefits of tokenizing specific assets.Â â€œIn some cases, weâ€™re tokenizing things that donâ€™t need tokenization, but in some cases, weâ€™re tokenizing things that actually give you real, everyday value, right? And if you can see that everyday value, then that is a promising project,â€ Mahasneh told Cointelegraph. He said hype can drive project growth in the Web3 space, but providing everyday value should be the prioriâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin vs. digital fiat is freedom vs. serfdom
entry.summary: Opinion by: Simon Cain, contributor at Bitcoin Policy UK Most jurisdictions globally are researching, developing or implementing retail central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). If you see these as harmless move-with-the-times digital updates of old-fashioned paper money, look again. CBDCs potentially mean financial serfdom via a monetary panopticon where the authorities closely control every transaction.Â If you think this sounds paranoid, just consider the words of Augustin Carstens, head of the Bank for International Settlements â€” the central bank for the worldâ€™s central banks. Lamenting the authoritiesâ€™ current inability to control cash transactions, he says that with a CBDC, a â€œcentral bank will have absolute control on the rules and regulations that will determine use... also we will â€¦

entry.title: US Senate crypto bills stall amid Trump ties and ethics concerns
entry.summary: Efforts to pass crypto legislation in the US Senate face mounting resistance amid growing ethical concerns around US President Donald Trumpâ€™s ties to crypto. In a May 5 letter to the Office of Government Ethics, Senators Elizabeth Warren and Jeff Merkley said that Trump and his family stand to personally profit from an investment involving UAE state-backed firm MGX, crypto exchange Binance and World Liberty Financial (WLFI). The senators called for an urgent probe, warning the deal may violate the US Constitutionâ€™s Emoluments Clause and federal bribery statutes. At the center of the controversy is WLFIâ€™s USD1 stablecoin, reportedly chosen for a $2 billion investment MGX plans to make into Binance. The senators said the transaction amounts to a potential backdoor for foreign influence and sâ€¦

entry.title: Maybank To Add Transaction Limit, Cooling-Off Period For Reloads
entry.summary: Last year, Maybank announced the addition of a 12-hour cooling-off period for adjustments to online transfer limits. Soon, the bank will be doing the same for reload services, including mobile prepaid plan reloads and game credits with PIN. This naturally also means that these transactions will also get limits when the change takes effect. Per [â€¦] The post Maybank To Add Transaction Limit, Cooling-Off Period For Reloads appeared first on Lowyat.NET.

entry.title: Bitcoin Core to unilaterally remove controversial OP-Return limit
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core developers have decided to remove a limit on transaction data in the next network upgrade, enabling more data to be included in a more efficient way.Â â€œBitcoin Coreâ€™s next release will, by default, relay and mine transactions whose OP_RETURN outputs exceed 80 bytes and allow any number of these outputs,â€ read the announcement on GitHub by Bitcoin developer Greg Sanders on May 5.Â The long-standing limit was originally a â€œgentle signal that block space should be used sparingly for non-payment proof of publication data,â€ has outlived its utility, he added.Â The proposal (PR 32359) was created by Bitcoin pioneer Peter Todd at the request of Chaincode Labs.Â OP_RETURN is a special type of Bitcoin (BTC) transaction output that allows storing small amounts of data on the blockchain,â€¦

entry.title: Celsiusâ€™ Mashinsky lashes out at â€˜death-in-prison sentenceâ€™
entry.summary: Alex Mashinsky, the founder and former CEO of bankrupt crypto lending platform Celsius, has blasted the government's 20-year â€œvenom-lacedâ€ sentence request, declaring it a â€œdeath-in-prison sentence.â€ The US Department of Justice requested Mashinsky receive at least 20 years behind bars in the May 8 sentencing for his role in misleading Celsius users and profiting from the price manipulation of Celsius (CEL), which would make the 59-year-old 79 if he serves the whole sentence. Lawyers acting for Mashinsky argued in a May 5 reply memorandum filed in a New York district court that he should receive no more than 366 days, because the DOJ hasn't taken into account his status as a nonviolent first-time offender with a previously unblemished 30-year history in business.Â Â â€œThe government's venom-â€¦

The company and existing stockholders are aiming to raise $500 million through offering a total of 10 million shares priced between $46 to $50 apiece, eToro said on May 5. A filing with the US Securities and Exchange Commission shows eToro is offering 5 million shares, with a further 5 million being put up by the likes of the companyâ€™s co-founder and CEO, Yoni Assia; his brother and executive director, Ronen Assia; along with venture firms Spark Capital, BRM Group and Andalusian Private Capital, among others. The company offers stock and crypto trading targeting retail and plans to liâ€¦

entry.title: Suspect in $190M Nomad hack to be extradited to the US: Report
entry.summary: A Russian-Israeli citizen allegedly involved in the $190 million Nomad bridge hack will soon be extradited to the US after he was reportedly arrested at an Israeli airport while boarding a flight to Russia.Â Alexander Gurevich will be investigated for his alleged involvement in several â€œcomputer crimes,â€ including laundering millions of dollars and transferring stolen property allegedly connected to the Nomad Bridge hack in 2022, The Jerusalem Post reported on May 5. Gurevich returned to Israel from an overseas trip on April 19 but was ordered to appear before the Jerusalem District Court for an extradition hearing soon after, according to the report.Â On April 29, Gurevich changed his name in Israelâ€™s Population Registry to â€œAlexander Blockâ€ and received a passport under that name at Israâ€¦

entry.title: Florida takes strategic Bitcoin reserve bills off the table
entry.summary: Two Florida crypto bills have been removed from the legislative process in the latest blow to American state-level strategic Bitcoin reserve ambitions.Â Floridaâ€™s House Bill 487 and Senate Bill 550 have been â€œindefinitely postponed and withdrawn from considerationâ€ on May 3, according to the Florida Senate.Â Floridaâ€™s legislative session adjourned on May 2 without the passage of these two bills, which would have advanced legislation to establish a crypto reserve for the state. The Senate and House agreed to extend the session until June 6 to address budget plans.Â Lawmakers passed about 230 bills during the session, dealing with things like prohibiting putting fluoride in the water, protecting state parks, and a school smartphone ban, but diversifying state treasury portfolios was not amonâ€¦

We will never ask anyone for payments like this via DM or otherwise,â€ they said.Â The team said that based on the illicit contract address the hacker posted, the amount improperly solicited appeared to be around $45,000.Â Asked whether the same hacker could be responâ€¦

entry.title: Fresh $1B in Tether mints on Tron, closing gap again with Ethereum
entry.summary: The Tron network has drawn closer to regaining the lead from Ethereum in Tether circulation after another big mint by the US stablecoin issuer. On May 5, Tether minted another $1 billion Tether (USDT) on the Tron network, according to Arkham Intelligence. This brings the total USDT on Tron to $71.4 billion, according to the Tether Transparency report.Â In comparison, there is currently $72.8 billion USDT circulating on the Ethereum network, so just $1.4 billion more USDT on Tron will see it become the leading network for the worldâ€™s largest stablecoin issuer, as it has been previously over the last two years.Â Tron was ahead of Ethereum for USDT circulation between July 2022 and November 2024, but a large $18 billion mint on Ethereum pushed the network ahead again, according to CryptoQuantâ€¦

entry.title: OpenAI to stay nonprofit, scrap proposed overhaul
entry.summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI has abandoned plans to become a for-profit company and reaffirmed commitment to its nonprofit status.Â In a May 5 blog post, OpenAI confirmed plans to convert its for-profit business unit into a so-called Public Benefit Corporation (PBC), which would remain under the nonprofitâ€™s control. PBCs are for-profit companies that are legally obligated to prioritize a social mission alongside the interests of shareholders. The plans mark a reversal for OpenAI, which had previously floated a for-profit conversion involving spinning out the nonprofit entity. â€œOpenAI was founded as a nonprofit, and is today overseen and controlled by that nonprofit. Going forward, it will continue to be overseen and controlled by that nonprofit,â€ the ChatGPT-maker said.Â This can be done withoutâ€¦

entry.title: Good actors were â€˜unfairly targetedâ€™ by SEC â€” OpenSea's CEO
entry.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commissionâ€™s (SEC) enforcement approach on crypto firms has left a lasting â€œregulatory overhangâ€ within the industry, according to Devin Finzer, co-founder and CEO of OpenSea.Â Speaking to Cointelegraph, Finzer said that during Biden's administration the agency unfairly targeted good actors in the crypto space, including OpenSea. â€œThere's all sorts of digital assets, you know, you shouldn't treat them all the same. That's obvious. But I think the approach that the prior SEC was taking was kind of this, you know, very, very generic.â€ The SEC issued a Wells notice â€” a formal notification that is often a precursor to enforcement action â€” to OpenSea in 2024, alleging that the NFT marketplace was operating as an exchange for unregistered securities. entry.title: Crypto market manipulation schemes are becoming increasingly coordinated
entry.summary: Opinion by: Tracy Jin, Chief Operating Officer, MEXC Market manipulation is everywhere and yet nowhere to be seen. It is an invisible threat affecting crypto and traditional markets, leaving ordinary traders counting the costs. Sometimes, manipulation is obvious â€” illiquid tokens being pumped high before being dumped just as fast â€” but often, it's subtler and more challenging to detect. What's more concerning is that these schemes are no longer the domain of rogue whales or amateur pump groups. Signs increasingly point to highly organized, well-funded networks coordinating activities across centralized exchanges, derivatives platforms, and onchain ecosystems. As these actors grow in sophistication, their threat to market integrity expands exponentially. A tale as old as timeÂ Market manipuâ€¦
